intro: Cupaniopsis denticulata, commonly known as the serrated cupaniopsis, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a small, evergreen shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. It is adapted to withstand salt spray and is often found in coastal dunes or heathlands. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
